class.name: PIXI.Matrix
class.help:
The Matrix class is now an object, which makes it a lot faster,
here is a representation of it :
| a | b | tx|
| c | d | ty|
| 0 | 0 | 1 |

public.name: apply

returns.help: The new point, transformed through this matrix

public.help: Get a new position with the current transformation applied.\nCan be used to go from a child's coordinate space to the world coordinate space. (e.g. rendering)

parameters.name: [newPos]
parameters.help: The point that the new position is assigned to (allowed to be same as input)

public.name: applyInverse

returns.help: The new point, inverse-transformed through this matrix

public.help: Get a new position with the inverse of the current transformation applied.\nCan be used to go from the world coordinate space to a child's coordinate space. (e.g. input)

parameters.name: [newPos]
parameters.help: The point that the new position is assigned to (allowed to be same as input)

public.name: fromArray
public.help:
Creates a Matrix object based on the given array. The Element to Matrix mapping order is as follows:

a = array[0]
b = array[1]
c = array[3]
d = array[4]
tx = array[2]
ty = array[5]

parameters.name: array
parameters.help: The array that the matrix will be populated from.

public.name: identity

returns.help: This matrix. Good for chaining method calls.

public.help: Resets this Matix to an identity (default) matrix.

public.name: toArray

returns.help: the newly created array which contains the matrix

public.help: Creates an array from the current Matrix object.

parameters.name: transpose
parameters.help: Whether we need to transpose the matrix or not

public.name: translate

returns.help: This matrix. Good for chaining method calls.
